reviews.review:
This game be good, better than the first Bioshock game which I got bored of half way through.

The worlds in this game are so well done, they are just fun to walk around in and there is a lot to do in the game.

The characters and acting area also very good and the storyline is interesting.

I originally posted a more thorough review that didn't get saved for some reason, and I'm too lazy to rewrite it, so here, take it and leave. 
5/5
*EDIT*
I have actually about 30 hrs on this game, Steam just has trouble recognizing when I'm playing a game.
L'un des meilleurs jeux , j'adore.
bah! if you loved Bioshock 1&2 then you probably wont like this one. i know i didnt. its nothing like the others.

Bioshock Infinite is one of my favorite games i have ever played because of it's amazing story, twists, and innovation.  The story is one you just have to experience along with the twists.  I really loved how they went away from the dark and danky atmosphere from the first two games and innovated into an awesome looking place named Columbia.  I liked the gunplay but its only good enough, it really could be alot better and i mean alot.  I liked the new salt and vigor system and works very well.  The way the game looks is amazing and uses great color.  Putting this game at the highest settings looks like watching a newborn baby be born. Its beautiful and great thing is that it has been optimized well and didn't tank the fps much at all.  The game is one of my favorites for its amazing dialouge and the main characters interactions.  Love it, love it, love it.  Buy this game to have the ride of your year. 10/10
One of the greatest games i have ever played, Definitley my favorite so far. So glad they released dlc as i just wanted more

Игру брать всем. Сюжет. Шутерная часть конечно достаточно средняя, играть советую на харде. История такая что под конце отваливаеться челюсть от того как все они закрутили. Музыка ну что музыка достаточно не плоха. Слов нет описать столь шикарный проект. Брать всем. 10\10 играйте только в лучшее.

This game is absolutely stunning!! From the visuals to the solid story line, the game keeps you guessing what is gonna happen next. Unfortunately, there is not multiplayer which results in a real bummer. Thankfully thou, there is DLC which gets you further into the game. Anywho, its a 10/10

Bioshock Infinite is an excellent FPS with beautiful graphics and a truly fascinating (if oftentimes ambiguous) storyline. It is a fine addition to a fine series and I would strongly recommend playing at least Bioshock 1 before Infinite, but while you're at it you should play 2 as well because it too is a great ride!

Infinite contains a beautifully sculpted world--Columbia--which rivals Rapture in its depth (though not literally) and immersiveness. The gameplay is far more action or combat-based than Bioshock 1, which focused more on a kind of rudimentary stealth. In this sense, the action in Bioshock infinite is far superior to its predecessors and is actually a hell of a lot of fun at times. Almost all of the weapons and vigors (i.e. plasmids) are fun and useful in some way, which adds greatly to the variety of gameplay options. As for the story, it is extremely hard to top the kind of atmosphere created by the story in Bioshock 1, and I think Infinite's just falls short. However, as it progresses it becomes increasingly complex and far more interesting in a way that neither of its predecessors achieved. Without spoiling anything, the ending is far from unsatisfactory to those who like to actually *think* about the games they play.

All in all, the game is excellent. I would highly recommend to any gamer. 9/10.
Игра в целом хорошая советую по играть,графика и эпизоды тоже отличны,советую по играть в другие части Bioshok

Gerçekten çok zevkli ve güzel bir oyun.Uçan Şehir Columbia da geçen oyunumuz görsel olarak iştah açıcı.Oyun içeriği adil(
genelde insan vs. insan),sıkıcı değil,çeşitli,gelişmiş ve efsanevi bir oyun.Herkese tavsiye ederim.

Les joueurs sont en général beaucoup plus critiques avec les grosses productions, et c'est bien normal. De nombreuses heures de travail, des sommes considérables et beaucoup de talent sont investis dans ces mastodonts du jeu vidéo que l'on finira par payer avec un prix considérable.

Les défauts de BioShock Infinite seraient bien plus pardonnables dans un jeu plus modeste, mais là ils tranchent clairement. Une mauvaise introduction et utilisation des ennemis, des combats répétitifs en arêne fermée, des armes sans imagination, un scénario soit prétentieux, soit non intéressant, des pouvoirs/toniques soit inutiles, soit superflues, un world-design qui sent l'artificiel (les toniques, encore...), etc.

Les bons côtés du jeu aident heureusement  à quand même apprécier les heures passées devant : le personnage d'Elizabeth, l'ambiance de Columbia, certaines scènes ou chapitres entiers qui sortent du lot...

La majeure partie des déceptions sur ce jeu ne peuvent être dits sans le spoiler, je vais donc m'arrêter là, mais sachez que je ne recommande pas ce jeu. Passez votre chemin, car il est fortement possible vous en ressortiez avec un gout de cendre dans la bouche.

Also ich glaube, ich habe noch nie solange über ein Spiel nachgedacht nachdem ich es zuende gspielt hatte. Es wird super erzählt, sieht super aus und es fühlt sich einfach super an.
Jeder der sich mal einen Ego"shooter" mit einer super Story angucken sollte, ist hier genau richtig. Und vielleicht solltest du dir dann, wenn dir dieses Spiel gefällt, auch die Vorgänger Bioshock 1 und 2 angucken. Sind super Spiele :D
This is the best game I have ever played!

Quite a beautiful game in many areas.  I'm not going to waste my time telling you how great it is, because everyone else has done it for me.  It's a shame Burial at Sea is a bit of a buggy mess.  Also, the game is huge.  37GB with Burial at Sea included, so if you are on an SSD, or have slow internet, this game may be a bit large for you.

Dishonored and Borderlands had a baby and it was adopted by Bioshock.

Pretty good game, not nearly as good at Bioshock 1 but still lots to see and experience.

People seem to hate on it a lot, and I'm not saying this game doesn't deserve [i]some[/i] of the hate, but it's certainly not a bad game.

The main criticism I have for this game is that it's too violent, which is a stark contrast to the beauty of the environment and themes. The gameplay is.... welll the gameplay is just too boring. I remember an E3 gameplay from several years back that made it seem like Booker had to make some split second moral decisions, such as threatening a guy to back off versus actually shooting him. There's NONE of that at all here! Booker essentially commits genocide of all of Columbia. I'm not sure of Ken Levine and his team were unable to incorporate the complicated systems of A.I. interactions in the game or what, but it's disappointing to see this game become just like a long, drawn out COD-like slog.

Even so, the storyline itself kept me engrossed through all the mindless killing and the graphics were really pleasing, especially in the beginning before Columbia gets fucked up.

Probably the second best Bioshock out of the three, which is still pretty high above average.

8/10

It is one of my favorite single-player experiences in every way. The game and the DLC are both amazing. Really the DLC is a game of its own. 10/10.
It's good.

Now. One can say that Bioshock Infinite it really something else than the original series (Pre-DLC), but maybe not as dark. Bioshock Infinite takes you through an amazing story and a different way of playing. The story isn't bad, and the achievements makes you wanna play even more, even after you have finished it. There are also 3 DLCS. I started and completed the game at hard, and that's pretty fine if you want a steaper learning curve or simply know how to hit. There is another harder difficulty, but that's for you to explore ;)!

Clash in the clouds, Burial at sea episode 1 and 2 are the 3 DLCs.

Clash in the clouds is really funny, but also a bit of annoying, especially if you love achievements and challenges like me. This sets place in 4 different "arenas", where you can earn money for all the vigor and weapon upgrades. You get extra cash for doing the challenges, which can sometimes be obnoxiously hard. As per today there are still 2 ouf of the 60 challenges I have not done. My problem is that I am getting so tired of doing it over and over again now, in this final level I am in. I hope to do it. Clash in the clouds is fun, until a certain point. And that is that.

Burial at sea ep. 1 - A deeper story of rapture. It was kinda fun! Good story, small secrets and worth to get the audio dialogues for. Remember that you can buy upgrades for weapon/vigor before getting it!

Burial at sea ep. 2 - This time you play as "someone else". This "someone else" is maybe not as though as Booker, and requires a bit more stealthy approach, and that is what makes it fun! You have to learn to play the game in a different way than before.

All in all. Amazing game. Also the DLCs. Lots of times spent here on this one. I took a ton of screenshots, and well....that's a proof the game is graphically great aswell :)! It sure is!

Play it!

This game shook the bounds of what I considered to be a good game and added a whole new set levels for future games to cross when I call them a good and or worthy to play. 

I will do that which I can to spare you any spoilage. This game left me, and stille leaves me as I type this review, baffled and awe struck at the drawing, grasping and fantastic story which makes the game more than the actual game does. I found myself considering this a form of a movie while playing. This game explores deep themes, making me consider things which I see come up all to often such as what religion can do in the right, or wrong hands. This game has you question your own morales as you lead Booker through this wonderous floating city. The graphics only help to compliment the story as the game flows perfectly to your command.

This game is fantastic. I thought it would be good, but I could not have expected it to be nearly this fantasticly crafted and filled with deep themes that I still question after beating the game.

Bioshock Infinite ist eine gelungene Fortsetzung der Vorgänger. Es hat mich sowohl grafisch, als auch mit der Story beeindruckt. Vom Gameplay her lässt es sich so gut spielen wie der 2. Teil der Reihe. Ich kann es für Fans von Bioshock 1&2, als auch allen anderen wärmstens Empfehlen!!!

"Will the circle be unbroken / by and by, by and by? / Is a better home awaiting / In the sky, in the sky?"

This is the chorus to a Christian hymn heard countless times during Bioshock Infinite. While the lyrics originally intend to find solace in meeting one's ancestors in heaven, Bioshock Infinite Creative Director Ken Levine takes the hymn literally in establishing Columbia, the floating utopia on which his latest game takes place.

Columbia is the result of self-proclaimed "prophet" Zachary Comstock feeling that he must establish "an Ark for a new time" in the sky. This Ark separates the true believers, who worship the ideals expounded by the founding fathers of America, from the godless heathens of America circa 1912.

Comstock's hyper-American floating city sounds grand enough on paper, but in execution, the sights and sounds frequently made my jaw drop. Bioshock Infinite dares to be different with an art style that is vibrant and diverse while still remaining cohesive. The bright colors, lively music, and larger-than-life statues brought me back to Disneyland's Main Street of all places. Sure, it doesn't seem believable that ordinary folks would actually live there, but in the depths of my imagination, Columbia could actually exist. The city isn't just there to look pretty either. Columbia is chock-full of details that contribute valuable details to the narrative.
bioshock infinite columbia
The setup for Bioshock Infinite's plot is pretty basic: Booker DeWitt, a mentally scarred war veteran down on his luck, is in debt to the wrong people. When Booker is offered a chance to rescue a girl named Elizabeth in exchange for an erasure of his debt, he jumps at the chance. This basic premise allows any player to get into the action and feel like there is a "reason" for everything that happens on screen, but players who take the time to analyze the game world will be highly rewarded. The nature of Booker's debt is never directly explained in the narrative, but if you look at Booker's desk in his office, the mountain of losing horse race tickets might give it away.

One important detail that expedient players will run past completely is Bioshock Infinite's honest portrayal of racism in the 1900's. It is brought to the forefront a little bit at the beginning of the story but only through overhearing conversations, and thoroughly exploring the environment, do you get the full picture. Time and time again, one doesn't get the full experience unless you take up Bioshock Infinite's frequent offers to ignore the main objective and explore the storefronts, slums, and back-alleys of Columbia. There is such an abundance of story details living in the walls of the game that Columbia shouldn't just be considered the setting of Bioshock Infinite; it's one of the main characters. A journey through Columbia makes every other game world feel dull and lifeless by comparison.
bioshock infinite garden
The core of Infinite's plot is the relationship between protagonist Booker DeWitt and Elizabeth. Players meet Elizabeth about an hour into the game, rescuing her from atop Columbia's tallest tower. From here, the story shifts towards a breakneck pace of firefights across not only the city but, thanks to Elizabeth's power to open portals, across dimensions as well.

The relationship between Booker and Elizabeth generates more emotional moments than I have experienced in any recent shooter. Watching Elizabeth and Booker grow closer was more exciting than all the explosions in the entire game put together. The twists and turns are constant throughout the 12 hour storyline until the very end when the rug is pulled out from underneath you, and that is where the genius of Bioshock Infinite really shines. The brilliantly confounding ending is the cherry on top of what is already one of gaming's best stories. But enough about the narrative: how does it play?
Bioshock Infinite Elizabeth
The rescue mission premise for Bioshock Infinite may give the wrong impression. Normally, games centered around escorting a weaker character mean constantly halting the flow of an action sequence to check on an inept companion. Fortunately, while Elizabeth experiences quite a shock after first witnessing violent acts, she quickly becomes indispensable in battle. Whenever Booker gets injured, runs low on ammo or "salts" (mana), a quick button prompt turns the player to face Elizabeth to catch a quick resupply. Elizabeth can also use her dimension-warping powers to summon cover, weapons, health kits, or environmental hazards into the scene, though only one can be active at a time. This contributes to the frantic nature of the combat, which is already hectic with just Booker on his own.
bioshock infinite gameplay
Bioshock Infinite decks Booker out with the standard supply of first-person-shooter guns. The shooting by itself is smooth and satisfying enough but the real fun comes in "Vigors", the array of magical powers Booker can shoot from his left hand. I found the array of powers in Bioshock Infinite to be much more satisfying than those in the original Bioshock. Depending on how many enemies there are in an encounter, or even how many of them are human or machine, the power that can most efficiently dispatch of them will change. This encourages more experimentation than the Bioshock of 2007, but I still found myself settling on a one-size-fits-all approach for the final third of the game, which is heavy on large firefights. The combination was Bucking Bronco / Shotgun to the face, by the way.

Overall, the gameplay in Bioshock Infinite is on par with most of its contemporaries. The original Bioshock's combat was clunky even by 2007 standards, so it's good to see the series take such a strong leap forward. However, while I appreciate the stress-free aspects of not needing to constantly tend to Elizabeth, there could have been more interaction between her and Booker in combat to deepen their relationship. Still, that is a minor nitpick given how satisfying the combat feels compared to all the other games in the series.
bioshock infinite prayer
Irrational Games has achieved several milestones in Bioshock Infinite. They put out a shooter with mass market appeal that is about much more than shooting. Racism, sexism, religion, and controversial events from America's history are explored by the story's end. The floating city of Columbia hits unforgettable status after about five minutes, with visuals that forced me to mouth "wow" at my computer screen constantly. Irrational also cultivates a genuinely heartwarming relationship between two main characters in a game that otherwise delights in the surreal. The unforgettable introduction of Columbia transitions seamlessly into an action-packed middle, which slams into an ending that begs to be thought over, picked at, and discussed with friends.

Bioshock Infinite is the best shooter I have played in a long time. It is an incredible achievement artistically, narratively, and technically. I can't think of a better game to close out and define this decade-long console generation.

Здесь есть всё, красивая графика, обалденный сюжет, атмосфера, удобный геймплей, ну и конечно нельзя не сказать про Элизабет, очень красивая, никогда не мешается под ногами и выручает когда это необходимо, вообщем идеальный компаньон. Excellent game.
You can see the developers put love into this.

11/10

The flying city of Columbia is an incredibly engrossing world to explore. Sure, it's stuffed full of lunatics and sin but you take it all in stride. That's guns and drug-induced sorcery are for.  

BioShock Infinite is one hell of a ride. You'll never stop being surprised, disgusted, delighted, or possibly all of those at any given moment. And underneath all of the grittiness are some really relevant themes about social decay, morality, and faith. Some pretty heavy stuff for sure. 

My only real gripe with the title is how easy the game is, even on high difficulties. Some of the plot devices also confusing or come across as lazy. However, these issues don't take away from the overall experience.

So would you kindly purchase this game and enjoy your mad romp through Columbia?

Best world in a video game? It might not be, but it certainly is on the top list. With a linear path to follow but an excellent environment, from NPCs to the overworld, this Bioshock Infinite gives you the feeling of being in the world itself.

Great story and character design, with some extra background story easy to follow but not to understand. Focusing in this game will be crucial to understand the whole story.

Great diversity of weapons, either being guns or powers, each one with different utilities.

Having finished one play through of this game (taking it steadily and trying to savour it),  I think I can about start to comment.
Mixed feelings really.  I was blown away by the first Bioshock, and the diversity in the design, and architecture of Rapture.  Columbia seems more of a one-trick pony.  Very nicely done, but nowhere near so varied.  The gameplay is fast and furious, much like the predeccessors, and the story is excellant.  In fact, the game is worht it for the ending alone.  If I'm honest, I found the relationship with Elizabeth quite contrived, and even annoying at times (she gets angry, you chase her, rescue her, calm her down, rinse and repeat).
So certainly a worthwhile experience, and a wonderfully polished game, but nothing like as powerful or surprising as the first Bioshock.  In my opinion.

Awesome, totally worth the money i paid for it, it's a must buy

cool game. some  of the cut scenes are a little long. Good stuff and I enjoyed playing it through. Looking forward to playing it through again on 1999 mode (hardcore)

Okay. This is going to be an in-depth review of the game as a stand-alone game, and as a part of the series, divided by the various elements that make a game, well, you know, a game.

Gameplay:
As a Part of The Bioshock Series (assuming you have already played them):
Seriously lacking. They replaced the Power To The People Station with simple and cheap ways of weapon upgrades, which is, as a part of the series, a dissapointment. They replaced the plasmids with vigors which are frankly awesome, but not THAT new. What was new was the introduction to traps, which was very well handled. But what I cannot forgive is that they took away the ADAM gathering, and moved away its upgrades to simple vending machines, giving the game a much easier experience, apart from the serie's particular difficulty. 8/10
As a Stand-Alone Game:
Different, innovating, thrilling and rewarding, not to mention hard. Vigors kept the experience fresh, and the guns were well balanced. Good work. 9/10

Storyline
As a part of the Bioshock Series: 
Good enough. It provided new and fresh ideas, but keeping the feel of being a Bioshock game. The unfolding of the story trough voxophones is brilliant, and, as compared to the stories in previous games, much, much more coherent and entertaining. 9/10
As a Stand-Alone game:
An absolute Masterpiece. Mind-blowing, exciting and amazing in every way. The characters are beautiful, the voice-acting is tremendously well done, and, not to spoiler anything, an ending worth crying for. 10/10

Other elements:
Animation: Perfect in every way. Very well done. Way better than the series (due to the fact that most of the main character in previous installments had little to no screen time) 9/10
Soundtrack: Very well put toghether as actual parts of the storyline. 9/10
DLC's: Absolute must haves. (Maybe Clash In the Clouds not as much) but the Burial at Sea series are definetly worth getting. ESPECIALLY if you played both previous Bioshock games. They may have their own reviews later on.
Graphics/art: The art, as it's common among the Bioshock games is absolutely, amazingly beautiful. Therefore, the graphics are really, really good. 10/10

Overall:
As a part of the Bioshock Series: 8.5/10.    The gameplay changes were a serious letdown.
As a Stand Alone Game: 9.7/10

The ending is way too good. It was better than some movies that I've watched tbh
The overall graphics was impressive as well, showing the good work in portraying the Dystopia that was veiled in the deceptive image of a beautiful and contrasting Utopia that floats by science. 
Gameplay, for the most part, was fun and exotic because you could use abilities that you have picked up. Also the small things that you could discover while roaming are interesting things to find. 
The difficulties scaled by the type of units was significant and made the game more challenging.

Overall I loved Bioshock Infinite (and after the ending I realized why it's called Infinite), but the only thing is that the game ended way too fast. It just makes me want to buy DLCs and play them. Well those would be single stories and end as well.

But for real, get this game. Though, it's rather expensive (30 bucks!) so I recommend buying it when it's on sale.

Dopo aver giocato i primi due capitoli di Bioshock (solo una sviluppato da Irrational games) ho cominciato a giocatore a Infinite. All'inizio ero un po' titubante perchè l'atmosfera molto dark di Bioshock 1 e 2 (che mi era piaciuta) non la ritrovavo in Infinite. Stessa cosa dell'ambientazione, da Rapture immersa nell'oceano, a Colombia immersa nelle nuvole. Poi con il passare delle ore di gioco ho capito che il nuovo capitolo aveva qualche aggancio con i primi due capitoli ma era a se stante. Da quel momento in poi la trama è diventata più avvincente e inprevedibile. Tutto era logico ma allo stesso tempo illogico come i due fratelli gemelli Lutece. Non c'era da capire, era da giocare e basta. Un finale inaspettato che ti lascia a bocca aperta, la ciliegina sulla torta. Ho giocato anche i due DLC Burial of Sea: aggiungono ore di gioco e soprattutto risposte come me su quale legame ci fosse tra Rapture e Columbia. Devo dire molto avvincenti i due episodi ma sinceramente invece di chiarire, fanno più confusione nella testa del videogiocatore. Per il resto consigliatissimo!!! Voto 9/10

If you don't wan't a game that is grounded in realism, then this is the game for you. The game faetures cartoon graphics which feels like committe drawn up ideas of what it means to be indie, not too mention the ridiculous floating city (based on zeplins), just because its trying to be edgy and provide a throwback to the old Americana ideals of the future or scifi reality. The game just feels transparent and contrived, coupling the apparent wonder the Americana references are designed to create with the a dark story and combat just feels done already, particularly in the original bioshocks....in short boring, committee  designed rubbish aimed at trying to market to those who feel like they have to say they like the game because it unusual....it sucks

It's a very pretty and well optimized game (I was surprised when i saw how high my framerate was at max settings) but when it comes to everything else I felt quite dissapointed. It's not a bad game but I think it is massivly over-rated. 

The levels are super linear, the enemies are huge bullet sponges. I actually almost got stuck once because it takes so much ammo to kill one of the bosses and when you die you don't get your ammo back and you loose money you could use to buy ammo. It doesn't help that you can only carry 2 weapons at a time and the enemies end up dropping ammo for guns you are not carrying. Protip Don't play on hard-mode. It doesn't make it more challanging it just makes it more annoying.

Elizabeth was sadly a dissapointment as well. She doesn't actually help you fight. She is ignored by all enemies and she ignores all enemies. All she does is throw supplies at you and trigger different things.

I was not a huge fan of the story either. While the dialouge and atmosphere of the places you visit are nice it also has a lot of shortcomings. None of the choises you make, makes a difference and the ending isn't explained very well. I do understand what they are trying to do but I just don't think they executed and explained it very well. Without spoiling anything its also flawed and doesn't make any sense. They also tease you to fight a certain boss the entire game but it never ends up happening which was a huge dissapointment.

I bought this game full-price though and at a lower cost it is definatly worth checking out, despite its shortcomings. I just needed to give it some critique because no-one seems to do so. You need a bit of both to get a fair look at a product.

This game is incredible.

First of all, the graphics are jaw-droppingly beautiful - I quite often find myself admiring the graphics and forgetting about the gameplay! 

The shooting element is not as good as it perhaps could be, but it is still responsive and fun. There are some original gameplay mechanics here too. The story is very good with a lot of surprises.

You need to play this game if you haven't already!

OHAAAAA . . . So was habe ich noch nieee gesehen !!!
Ich habe die ersten zwei Teile von Bioshock zwar noch nicht gespielt, weiß aber worum es geht, da ich etliche LPs gesehen habe. Und da dachte ich mir ,,Hmmm . . . die haben den zwei Bioshocks schon ganz schön was her gemacht, wie können die das noch toppen ???" 
Aber Fakt ist . . . Sie haben sich wieder übertroffen (gemeint sind die Entwickler von Bioshock) !!!

Das was dieses Spiel ausmacht ist nicht etwas die hervorragende Story mit ihre Twists und Turns, sondern diese krasse Atmosphere die einem geboten wird. Sowas habe ich in noch keinem anderen Spiel gesehen.

Absolut spielenswert !

Wer auf Bioshock verzichtet, hat definitiv etwas wunderschönes verpasst.

Beim Zocken sich manchmal meine Nackenhaare aufgestellt, da die Atmosphäre manchmal AWSOME und manchmal leicht Horror mäßig war.

BLIND KAUFEN ! ! !
Grande con mayusculas, no necesito decir nada mas.

This game is so epically awesome...the story is neck and neck with movies like Inception, and The Prestige. The character you play as is relatible and says things during the game that I was thinking myself. This makes the game feel even more real as you play it. The Graphics are insane and very immersive. And that's the bottom line!

Ich möchte vorweg sagen ich bin voreingenommen da Bioshock meine absolute lieblingsspieleserie ist.
Der grund dafür zeigt sich auch in diesem Teil.
Nummer 1: Neue Umgebung die wunderschön anzuschauen ist, bringt abwechslung
Nummer 2: Atmosphäre wie immer sehr sehr gut, nicht so düster wie die ersten beiden teile (naja was will man machen ist eben keine Stadt auf dem Meeresgrund da ists eben heller)
Nummer 3: Story! Ich muss zugeben das Infinite in der hinsicht mein Favorit der 3 teile ist (verschlungen und bis zuletzt spannend - wenn man sie auch "richtig" versteht) 

Rückblickend muss ich allerdings auch einen Punkt bemängeln: Das, wie hier schon oft angesprochene, Gameplay.
Auf jeden fall geschmacksache, ich empfand es als gut, hätte waffentechnisch ein wenig inovativer sein können.
Es war auch ein wenig repetetiv, ich war allerdings so gefesselt von der Atmosphäre und der Story das ich nicht all zu viel davon mitbekommen habe.

Und ich will nicht zu viel verraten aber das DLC erzälht einen bis dato noch unbekannten Teil der Geschichte um Rapture.

Abschließend kann ich das Spiel nur wärmstens empfehlen, nach dem ende hat es, wie auch seine Vorgänger, ein kleines loch in meinem Spielerherzen hinterlassen, so wie das ein exzellentes Spiel eben tun sollte.


Ich freue mich auf einen würdigen Nachfolger.

This is my favorite game out of any I have played.  The storyline is perfect, and you quickly will get used to Elisabeth helping you along the way.  She is a complex character, but an excellent complex character.  She never gets in your way during combat, and only helps out.  Her reactions to different situations seem very sincere. 

Shooting mechanics are nice - it isn't out to win a realism award, but it’s predictable and fun.  The guns seem balanced with ammunition and firepower.  I just wish the hook was used more in combat.

While I haven't turned the graphics all the way up yet, the game looks pretty darn good.

If you played Bioshock, I highly recommend you continue the storyline and play this one as well.

While the gameplay feels fairly generic, the insane level of polish, beautiful  and colorful graphics  and well knit sci fi plot make it worth playing through the entire 9-14 hr story. 

The animations are fluid and entertaining, the dialogue is spot on, and Elizabeth is a fantastic companion in terms of usefulness, AI, and character development.

I am personally not a big FPS guy and had not played Bioshock 1 or 2, and still found a lot to like about this game. The plot probably will not hook you until a couple of hours in, but once it does you will be drawn back to finish it just like a good sci fi novel.

at first i found the game a little boring but as the story unfolded i found myself wanting more and more.
